questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 subscription that contains 300 users.

All the users have existing direct inward dial (DID) phone numbers.

You plan to implement Phone System in Microsoft Teams.

You need to migrate the users' DID phone numbers to Microsoft Teams.

What should you do?

choices.B: From the Microsoft Teams admin center, run the porting wizard.
choices.D: From the Microsoft 365 admin center, open a service request.
choices.A: From Voice in the Microsoft Teams admin center, select Phone numbers, and then select Add.
choices.C: From the Microsoft Teams admin center, create a dial plan.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Love the wizard

Selected Answer: B
Correct
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/phone-number-calling-plans/transfer-phone-numbers-to-teams
Yes, you have to port the number

choices.C: From the Teams PowerShell module, create a network roaming policy.
choices.A: From Meeting settings in the Microsoft Teams admin center, configure the media port range to use any available ports.
choices.B: From Group Policy Management, create a Group Policy setting to specify the DSCP values.
choices.D: From Meeting policies in the Microsoft Teams admin center, configure the Media bit rate (Kbs) setting.

questions.question_text:
Your network contains an Active Directory domain. The domain contains 1,000 computers that run Windows 11.

Your company uses Microsoft Teams.

You need to ensure that the computers can prioritize audio and video during Teams meetings.

From the Microsoft Teams admin center, you set Insert Quality of Service (QoS) markers for real-time media traffic to On.

What should you do next?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Option B
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/qos-in-teams

"Using port-based tagging, your network's router examines an incoming packet, and if the packet arrived using a certain port or range of ports, it identifies it as a certain media type and puts it in the queue for that type, adding a predetermined DSCP mark to the IP Packet header so other devices can recognize its traffic type and give it priority in their queue."

Selected Answer: B
On exam 31/03/2023
B. In Group Policy Management, create a Group Policy setting to specify DSCP values.

By setting the Insert Quality of Service (QoS) markers for real-time media traffic as Enabled in the Microsoft Teams admin center, you allow Teams to automatically assign audio and video data packets with a Differentiated Services Code Point (DSCP) value. To ensure that computers prioritize real-time media traffic, you will need to create a Group Policy setting to specify the DSCP values. This will ensure that real-time media traffic has priority over other network activities. Setting the media port range and media bit rate is not necessary to prioritize audio and video during Teams meetings. Creating a network roaming policy in the Teams PowerShell module is not relevant to this scenario.

Selected Answer: B
ChatGPT agrees with answer B

The answer has to be "B".

"A" states: "configure the media port range to use any available ports."

You don't want to configure it for any available ports...

Selected Answer: A
In my opinion it should be A, as after activating QoS, we must select the port ranges for each real traffic in Meeting Settings (it automatically creates the related GPO).
Actually to check it’s working, firstly check that the GPO’s are crated, and then run the Network Monitor to ensure the ports are properly used.

Don’t need toncreate the GPO’s manually!

Selected Answer: B
Researched Best practice to set up QoS and it doesnt not mention adjusting use any port. Going with 
B because it is needed. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/qos-in-teams-clients

Selected Answer: B
Pffttt never forget your QoS, it's the bane of my existence

Selected Answer: B
Its B.

B. From Group Policy Management, create a Group Policy setting to specify the DSCP values.
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/qos-in-teams-clients

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

You have a Microsoft 365 subscription that uses Teams.

You have a meeting room that contains a Teams Rooms device and a Surface Hub.

You have the following configuration file for the Teams Rooms device.

//IMG//


You have the following configuration file for the Surface Hub:

//IMG//


For each of the following statements, select Yes if True. Otherwise select No.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

discussion.content: According https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/rooms/coordinated-meetings yyy „ Surface Hubs will always display a whiteboard shared by meeting participants.”
Agree with syougun200x. Answer should be Y-Y-Y

Wonder if the 3rd question is really No. If the what it says below is correct, the answer should be Yes (Surface Hubs will always display a whiteboard)? 

Unfortunately I have no license and devices to test. 

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/rooms/coordinated-meetings

Determines whether the Teams Rooms device will display a whiteboard shared by one of the meeting participants. We recommend that you set this to false if you have a Surface Hub and true if you don't have one. This setting has no effect on Surface Hubs. Surface Hubs will always display a whiteboard shared by meeting participants.

Y-Y-N
Correct

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

Your company uses Microsoft Teams.

You have a meeting policy named Policy1 that is assigned to a group named Sales.

You need to ensure that all the meetings recorded by the Sales group are stored indefinitely.
How should you complete the PowerShell cmdlet? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
Answer is Correct. 
Set-CsTeamsMeetingPolicy -Identity Policy1 -NewMeetingRecordingExpirationDays -1

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/module/skype/set-csteamsmeetingpolicy?view=skype-ps

-NewMeetingRecordingExpirationDays
Specifies the number of days before meeting recordings will expire and move to the recycle bin. Value can be from 1 to 99,999 days. Value can also be -1 to set meeting recordings to never expire.

choices.B: Create an emergency call routing policy.
choices.A: Provide the Emergency Location Identification Number (ELIN) associated with the emergency address.
choices.D: Specify the latitude and longitude of the location.

questions.question_text:
In the Microsoft Teams admin center, you attempt to add an emergency address as shown in the following exhibit.

//IMG//


You need to validate the address.

What should you do?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Address Validation: To ensure accurate emergency response, Microsoft Teams requires precise location information.
Latitude and Longitude: These coordinates provide the most accurate way to pinpoint a location on the map, enabling emergency services to locate callers quickly and efficiently.
Steps to Validate an Emergency Address:

Access the Microsoft Teams admin center.
Navigate to Locations > Emergency addresses.
Click Add to create a new address.
Enter the address details, including street address, city, state/province, and country/region.
Crucially, provide the latitude and longitude of the address.
You can typically find these coordinates using online mapping tools or GPS devices.
Click Save.
Makes sense
